intro: Taraxacum extenuens, commonly known as the slender dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, yellow composite flowers that develop into elongated, thin seed heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a distinctive basal rosette structure. Taraxacum extenuens is a perennial plant that is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
